intro: Capnoides campestris, commonly known as the field caper, is a shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Cucurbitaceae, which includes cucumbers and gourds. The plant features small, green, oval-shaped leaves and produces yellow flowers that develop into round, green fruits. Its botanical characteristics include a woody stem and a preference for arid or semi-arid environments. Capnoides campestris is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
